instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1286 820-2915-A that has green light, fan spin, big coils have voltage, CPU gets hot, but i get no usb activity.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
Post CPU core voltage?
When board boots, it should drop from 1.15V to 0.75V.
Beeps RAM error when RAM is removed?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
Tks.

No RAM beep when removed.

PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1/2/3 sometimes starts at 1.15VAND drops to 7.5v, but them oscilates bettwen 7.5 and 0.5V. 

Other times, they oscilates bettwen 1.15V and 0.144V

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
As far as I know, 7.5V is bigger than 1.15V.
And I'm pretty sure you've never got 7.5V at CPU core.
BTW, ALWAYS check DC voltage on the output pin of the coil, where the filter cap is connected.

Stable voltage at L7630?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

Sorry, you're right. I had bad batteries on multimeter.

PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1/2/3 starts at 1.15V AND drops to 0.75V steady.

L7630 has stable voltages. 1.25V on pin1 and 1V on pin2

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
No need to check L7630, if already got correct VCORE.
Looks like your board boots and should get USB activity, or external image.
If not, there should be a GPU problem, which blocks the CPU after booted.

Easy to disable GPU on this board, to confirm the problem.

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
I have no USB activity nither external image.
I disabled external GPU with medusa, but still no usb activity.

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message: Did you remove one of R8904/11 too?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message: No i dindn't. Shall i remove them?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message: OK, now i've removed R8911 and now i have usb activity. Is there other any way to solve this problem, without disabling / replacing the GPU?

threads.title: A1286 820-2915-A no boot
threads.message: Now you have to flash BIOS again, to disable GPU...
